name: Dev Environment Setup 2024
content:
üîß Dev Environment Setup Guide (updated Mar 2024)

================================================

Prerequisites:

- Node.js 18+ (https://nodejs.org)

- Docker Desktop (https://docker.com/products/docker-desktop)

- VS Code + extensions:

- ESLint

- Prettier

- Docker

1. Clone & Setup:

```bash

git clone git@github.com:synergyos/platform.git

cd platform

cp .env.example .env

npm install

```

2. Environment Variables:

```env

NODE_ENV=development

API_PORT=3000

DB_HOST=localhost

REDIS_URL=redis://localhost:6379

```

3. Start Services:

```bash

docker-compose up -d # starts postgres & redis

npm run migrate # run db migrations

npm run dev # start dev server

```

üö® Common Issues:

Port conflicts:

```bash

lsof -i :3000 # check what's using port 3000

kill -9 # kill process if needed

```

Database connection:

- Check if postgres is running: `docker ps | grep postgres`

- Try: `docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d`

- Reset DB: `npm run db:reset` (‚ö†Ô∏è destroys all data)

Node/NPM issues:

```bash

rm -rf node_modules

npm cache clean --force

npm install

```

üîó Useful Links:

- API Docs: http://localhost:3000/docs

- Admin Panel: http://localhost:3000/admin

- Metrics: http://localhost:9090

üìù Notes:

- Use `npm run test:watch` for TDD

- Prettier runs on pre-commit

- Ask in #dev-help for access tokens

- Don't forget to update swagger docs
